definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A thimbleful of a neutron star would weigh over 100 million tons
sentences.chinese: 一顆中子星很微量的一部分，重量也會超過1億噸。

sentences.english: Neutron stars contain the densest known matter that is directly observable.
sentences.chinese: 中子星擁有直接觀測到的最爲緻密的物質。

sentences.english: These binary systems consist of a neutron star orbiting around a supergiant star.
sentences.chinese: 這些雙星系統由一個巨星和圍繞其的中子星組成。

sentences.english: One teaspoonful of material from a neutron star would weigh a billion tonnes.
sentences.chinese: 一茶匙中子星上的物質重達十億噸。

sentences.english: Neutron superfluid vertex in neutron stars is discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 討論了中子星內中子超流渦旋。

sentences.english: Secondly, the equation of state of neutron matter at zero temperature is studied.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我們研究了零溫時中子星物質的物態方程。

sentences.english: Sometimes a neutron star results and sometimes a black hole.
sentences.chinese: 有時候她也可以變爲一箇中子星或者黑洞。

sentences.english: Magnetars are a type of neutron star which has a magnetic field a million billion times stronger than the Earth's.
sentences.chinese: 磁力星是一種具有了一百萬億次倍地球磁場的中子星。
